section.section:
The Board consists of the following 5 members:
as an ex officio member, the Commissioner; and
4 members appointed by the Governor with the advice and consent of the Senate.

Of the 4 appointed members:
2 shall represent collection agencies; and
2 shall be consumer members.

Each consumer member of the Board:
shall be a member of the general public; and
shall be:
an officer or member of the board of a recognized consumer group in the State; or
an employee of a local consumer protection unit in the State.

A consumer member of the Board may not:
be a licensee or otherwise be subject to regulation by the Board; or
within 1 year before appointment, have had a financial interest in or have received compensation from a person regulated by the Board.

text.section: While a member of the Board, a consumer member may not have a financial interest in or receive compensation from a person regulated by the Board.
Before taking office, each appointee to the Board shall take the oath required by Article I, § 9 of the Maryland Constitution.

section.section: The term of an appointed member is 4 years and begins on July 1.
At the end of a term, an appointed member continues to serve until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member who is appointed after a term has begun serves only for the rest of the term and until a successor is appointed and qualifies.

text.section: The Governor may remove an appointed member for incompetence or misconduct.
